documents.document:
Anxiety sucks😠
It’s invisible, intrusive, hateful, irritating, frightening & it can be constant. It’s so hard to explain
When I have #anxiety it makes me doubt absolutely every-freakin-thing I do
Oh... and luckily, anxiety is usually temporary & it can be treated or managed😊 https://t.co/IxMIAZOZeU
RT @NHS_ELFT: Just to let you know, the Crisis Cafe in Hackney will see all comers. They will talk with and review anyone who attends. And…
RT @ArielleTch: #JournoRequest Looking for a woman (aged 35+) who found love or got married this year to be featured in Good Housekeeping D…
@PJWNHSPtSafety ✅👌🏻

@PJWNHSPtSafety 🤦🏻‍♀️ unfortunately so... but I had great crisis care from @NHS_ELFT so my recovery was swift & smooth. Check out my thread, yesterday I think, about how receiving “outstanding” services feels like. Amazing stuff 🤗

@PJWNHSPtSafety Thanks Pete @PJWNHSPtSafety I’m doing great now thanks. A short, sharp, unexpected relapse... but had excellent care, was honest and open about it & looked after myself too... so I’m feeling so much better. Thanks for checking on me 💐
RT @JoshSmiiffy: If you tell somebody battling mental illness they’re fine or tomorrow’s a new day, you don’t realise half the battle
@Clarelyonscoll1 👀👌🏻🏆

@LiluWheeler @NHS_ELFT There are many many other options than train tracks. All mental health trusts have a crisisline, most 24/7. The Samaritans are amazing & many towns have drop-in centres. There are loads of other MH charities too, as well as using other community assets 🏊‍♂️🚴‍♂️🌼🦆👯‍♀️
Proud to be part of the team at @NHSBartsHealth 😎 https://t.co/YKmfLXuXuu

@LiluWheeler @mattwRMN I agree there should be MUCH better information about alternatives to A&E for people in #mentalhealth crisis. I understand there are new facilities at @RoyalLondonHosp and many mental health Trusts are now working on alternatives through the “crisis care concordat” 👍🏻

@mattwRMN Great to see initiatives coming up across the country for alternatives to A&E for people with #mentalhealth problems. @SWLSTG is a good example 👌🏻 based on a model from Birmingham (I think). Crisis Cafes such as @sabpNHS & @NHS_ELFT also very effective alternatives

@LiluWheeler My experience is consistently fantastic BECAUSE I live in the catchment area of @NHS_ELFT it has nothing to do with my job, my role or even my presence on social media. The Trust is rated outstanding & all the care I have seen other people receive has been the same Fab quality
RT @eliistender10: You either never got one and wanted one or you got one and thought it was shit https://t.co/PBpcNmK0uj
RT @Tommys_baby: 1 in 4 pregnancies end in loss. It's time to end the silence. Let’s come together to talk, share and support each other.
RT @DrAndyMayers: We need to smash #stigma towards maternal #mentalhealth and make it OK for mums to talk and seek help without fear of jud…
RT @shrewsmorris: NEVER, EVER THREATEN MORRIS DANCERS AGAIN OR WE WILL COME AND DANCE ON YOUR DOORSTEPS, IN YOUR GARDENS AND ON YOUR CARS M…
RT @IASP_ECG: So many exciting updates on suicide prevention internationally being shared at the National Suicide Prevention Conference in…
RT @NHSEnglandLDN: We're remembering the late Kate Granger in celebration of #HelloMyNameIs day, and would also like to thank her husband @…

Had to delete the tweet below; I got so many kind messages, likes, retweets & DMs... but it wasn’t MY experience. I rushed the tweeting (lesson learnt!) & didn’t note on that tweet it was about someone else. All ok now & she’s got help. Meanwhile, overawed by twitter love 🤗💖 xx https://t.co/crhoHNuIZx
RT @heathercaudle: The NHS England Safeguarding Team is recruiting for an interim Programme Manager. Go to NHS Jobs for our Interim Program…

11/11 Massive thanks to @NHS_ELFT CEO @NavinaEvans DoN @LorraineSunduza MD @DrGilluley & I’m sure @DrAmarShah is involved somewhere!
Your #mentalhealth services continue to be compassionate, responsive, thorough &wonderful 💐💐💐 as the @CareQualityComm rightly know #outstanding https://t.co/S1jVaVNdT9

10/11 I can’t remember all the lovely team who cared for me when I felt vulnerable; but I remember how each of them made me feel 🤗
-Special thanks to the Team Leader Charity for running a great show👌🏻 -& to Dr Sally for going the extra mile -All of the HTT were outstanding https://t.co/kDipA1BtRZ

9/11 After a final appt with the psychiatrist I was discharged on 12th July
In 2 weeks I’d benefited from intensive support, daily contact with HTT, medication review, CBT & I was well on my way to recovery
✅This is what Crisis Support is supposed to look & feel like 🌚➡️🌝

8/11 As well as all the face-to-face & phone support from the @NHS_ELFT HTT I was also signposted to the #hackney #crisiscafe, free online #CBT and #IAPT therapy
Well done to @NHSHomerton & @CityHackneyCCG for collaborative working & excellent commissioning 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 https://t.co/WjpCePGFQa

7/11 The team asked if there was anything else that may help me
🤔 Some #CBT for anxiety would be helpful... and as if by magic I received a call from HTT #psychologist the next day and two sessions of very helpful Cognitive Behaviour Therapy completed that week https://t.co/USxlcXdxLX

6/11 The psychiatrist liaised with the pharmacist & new prescription arranged & meds collected from Hospital pharmacy
The team even offered to bring the medication to me at home! But I picked it up myself

5/11 The psychiatrist & whole HTT made me feel supported, valued & like I mattered. This is crucial for people with depression & anxiety
Every contact with the team felt genuine & un-rushed with a strong focus on #recovery #Wellbeing & 24/7 compassionate community focussed care https://t.co/APmJmYdPQv

4/11 Comprehensive, thoughtful & challenging assessment by (lovely) psychiatrist. Assessment was about MY needs, not ticking boxes or KPIs
-What would help me? -How can the team help? -What’s helped me in the past? -Would therapy be of help? -What meds have helped me before?

3/11 Taken on by the Home Treatment Team for support and treatment for relapse in #depression & #anxiety
Contacted by phone daily & offered home visits as well as 24/7 access to the Team
Arranged assessment with HTT psychiatrist on Wednesday
https://t.co/T40vmYnK3c

2/11 I was referred to the Home Treatment Team (HTT) on Sat 30 June; offered same day assessment but I chose the next day as more convenient for me
Offered home visit, but I chose to go to team base. Seen by compassionate, experienced, thorough & professional #mentalhealth nurse

➡️Thread 1/11
I was hearing awful experiences of #mentalhealth service users talking today about difficulties in accessing mental health services #commpath
In contrast I wanted to share my recent experience of ⭐️outstanding⭐️ & responsive Crisis services from @NHS_ELFT https://t.co/F8AeiYKPzx

@ClaireCNWL Thanks so much @ClaireCNWL ... this was a service user’s story/experience at the @NCCMentalHealth #commpath event today. What an awful experience 😔 I spoke to her afterwards & have signposted her to local services & will follow up with her. 2 years tho!!! 🤦🏻‍♀️
RT @kempspace: Dear #RMN with #livedexperience, not sure how things are out there for you, is your lived experience valued in your professi…

☝🏻Tweet faux pas; I was so busy listening/tweeting at #commpath today that I didnt mention this was part of a service user’s story. Thanks 4ur kind tweets & DMs but this wasnt my experience! Ive spoken 2the lady &passed on ur messages& an offer of support from local services🤗
RT @MindCharity: Grief can be difficult to deal with. Christine blogs about how a local Mind helped her after losing her loved ones when sh…
RT @NCCMentalHealth: Words cannot express how proud & honoured we are to work with such amazing & brilliant people. The wealth & diversity…
Collaboration & coproduction at its finest ❤️ Part of the #CommPath group looking at the community mental health framework. What a handsome bunch 😍 https://t.co/qAn6wHDopF
@TomNCCMH @rcpsych Thank you so much @TomNCCMH ☺️💐 xx
@TomNCCMH @markybt @cityalan @JessBarrett227 @Lucille_Balls @chrislynch81 @nurse_palmer @stephaniedelaH2 @FourieCarla @GoodNewsFromBad @corstejo @DrSNThomas @skalidindi1 @subodhdave1 @david3012 😂😂😂
@VickyMcNally1 @rcpsych It’s been brilliant to be involved... learnt so much, so many Bright sparks in the room and real actual proper coproduction 👌🏻 #commpath
@ViralKMH @JessBarrett227 @NCCMentalHealth @rcpsych @TomNCCMH @PaulinaKJ_MH @llcarundell @saiqanccmh @Lucille_Balls @chrislynch81 @nurse_palmer We miss you at #CommPath @ViralKMH don’t overdo the 🍻
RT @JessBarrett227: Thank you to our wonderful #commpath panel for sharing their thoughts on the development, dissemination and implementat…

“This collaborative work has been all about coproduction. I’m proud to be associated with this new #commpath framework for community #mentalhealth support, care& treatment, but, we’ve got a lot more work for it to be a reality”
@cityalan on the discussion panel @NCCMentalHealth
RT @stephaniedelaH2: #commpath the “ expert panel” now up @david3012 @cityalan @FourieCarla & Mary but they say “ were not experts but peep…

RT @chrislynch81: @mandystevens22 Here's the link to the film
https://t.co/zCCXRf7Ha3

Colleagues and peers at the closing conference #commpath @NCCMentalHealth @rcpsych have agreed to honour a minutes silence in respect to the wonderful @GrangerKate this afternoon at 15:20 GMT @PointonChris #HelloMyNameIs #hellomynameisday https://t.co/XgAXjfFl4O

Our very own @chrislynch81 passionately talking about the wide ranging benefits of #PeerSupport
Video clips of peers: -a group of people I can rely on -people who understand me -the social activities really helps my anxiety -the group helps increase my confidence #commpath https://t.co/UK9JWGzh1O
RT @cityalan: I have just sat through one of the most powerful, challenging and important series of talks by people with lived experience a…

More people speaking, more hard truths:
“My family & others have been repeatedly let down by the current #mentalhealth system. Thats why Im involved in this #CommPath @NCCMentalHealth
I want to help improve services for people with severe & enduring #mentalillness like my son”

Hearing the hard truth from people:
“I’m a gay Muslim man with lived experience of mental health& Im a carer Services have called me ‘hard to reach’; what does that mean?”
“I have felt very valued as part of #CommPath; I was told Im 1 of the most important people at this table”
Be mindful when you’re talking to #carers that you get to understand more about the carer as a person too; it will help us work together and all feel better #CommPath

Listening to a Service User engaged in #commpath
➡️I’m as good as the day that I’m in
➡️It’s hard to find spaces to share my feelings & experiences
➡️I became the victim of my vulnerabilities
✅The @NCCMH has done something remarkable by engaging so many users & carers

Hearing from @stephaniedelaH2 about #coproduction; passionate, engaging & honest as always
“Coproduction is working together with people from the start to the end of any project that affects them”
This #commpath project is being truly coproduced ✅✅✅ https://t.co/jOmNgWIr1f
RT @JessBarrett227: Ready to kick off an exciting @NCCMentalHealth #commpath Closing Conference at @rcpsych today! As @TomNCCMH says "proba…

Im delighted to be Chairing the #CommPath closing conference at @rcpsych today
✅Inspiring colleagues, learning from best practice& creative ideas
Despite having high anxiety today Ive chosen to Chair, with care & support from my lovely colleagues &peers here🤗
#ItsOkNotToBeOk https://t.co/frAmCFUYiu
@bryony_gordon Really brilliant & timely advice... thank you 🤗❤️💐
RT @TimetoChange: Talking about mental health doesn't need to be awkward, and being there for a friend can make a huge difference. Our tips…
Don’t be embarrassed to ask someone about their #mentalhealth ... here are some good conversation starters 🗣👂🏻 https://t.co/syrWzgd0V5

@DannGooding Great tweet @DannGooding ... it’s put a big smile on my face & I’m sure on many others too 😊😊😊 enjoy your last shift... then look forward to the next wonderful part of your nursing career 🤗 (oh... & you’ll have to change your Twitter name soon too!)
RT @CEO_DavidB: @mandystevens22 @IZZIEDESIGNS @Bmat111 @SWLSTG @Ranjeet_Kaile I am indeed wearing it today to show support for #GarethSouth…
#ItsComingHome https://t.co/BxwFIFYWsS
@kennygibsonnhs @4AdsthePoet @IanGould5 @JennytheM @jcstaff_ @warnetony @jomwlever @NorthwayRuth @TinaSouth3 @KathEvans2 @MuziekGeluk Wise words @kennygibsonnhs thank you for the reminder 💐

Some simple but very helpful ideas to help improve accessibility for people with LD, autism, mental health problems in health services. Thanks for the #toptips @HannahtheOT 👍🏻 and FYI @CAlexanderNHS https://t.co/OCqD5BW1nR

@lottie08banana Keep going @lottie08banana it’s soooooooo worth it. There will be good days & tough days... difficult days and frickin’ AMAZING days. Nursing can be tough... get a good supervisor, get a supportive peer network and reach out on social media 😉 Keep up the great work 💙💙💙

RT @RoyalLondonHosp: So proud to officially open our Hope Room; the first A&E mental health room in the UK.
Artist @TheVisualVoice has tra…
RT @NHS_ELFT: CEO of @NHSBartsHealth and @NHS_ELFT Honouring the Hope Wall @NavinaEvans @A_WilliamsNHS https://t.co/oApZixLZ3X

@NHS_ELFT @NHSBartsHealth @NavinaEvans @A_WilliamsNHS Great to see this Navina & Alwen; #hope is key to #recovery in #mentalhealth. It’s vitally important to keep reminding people in despair that there’s hope for their future, hope for wellbeing and hope for a better tomorrow. Fab joint working between Acute & Mental Health services
@DrUmeshPrabhu Thank you @DrUmeshPrabhu ... but it’s grim when it’s our turn to go through it 😖 thank goodness for our wonderful #mentalhealth services
@lizcampbell41 Thank you 💐
@angiep3358 It sucks doesn’t it 🤦🏻‍♀️🙄 but we’re lucky as professionals, as we know we’ll recover ok. Yes, great to have support from those around us. Thanks for your support😊 #itstimetotalk
@DionneDaniel5 Thanks @DionneDaniel5 , that’s kind of you... I appreciate your support & understanding 💐
@NurseEiri Tea & cake? I’ll drop you a message @NurseEiri thank you xx
@fiholley @louisechicks1 @Frflatt @CAlexanderNHS @DionneDaniel5 @clairedavis45 @pagea01 @HeidiHmp2811 Thank you @fiholley much appreciated 💐

@JaneStClinPsy @louisechicks1 @Frflatt @CAlexanderNHS @DionneDaniel5 @clairedavis45 @pagea01 @HeidiHmp2811 Thank you @JaneStClinPsy I’m glad sharing my story helps other people be more open about their own #mentalhealth ... and yes, I hope it passes soon too... I’m following my #recoveryplan to the letter 😉 I know I’ll be 💯% again soon x
RT @JaneMCummings: @mandystevens22 Thank you for sharing Mandy and I always remember you saying “It’s OK not to be OK” I’m sending my love…

@JaneMCummings Big hug received with much thanks @JaneMCummings 🤗 I really appreciate your support & giving me both a voice & a national platform over the past year to raise awareness about #mentalhealth. Now I’m having to practice what I preach... not easy, but well worth it. Thanks again xx
@davidedwardkeen @PJWNHSPtSafety Thank you David
And @PJWNHSPtSafety too... but I couldn’t tag you in the photo 😊

I’m not proud that I have #anxiety & #depression again... but I’m also not embarrassed about it
Sharing my feelings, being honest & open has helped me so much this time
Big thanks to my work colleagues for reaching out to me at work & understanding; it means so much to me 🤗💐 https://t.co/Zis1t0P78D
👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 https://t.co/ylvjvvo5c5
“Whatever makes your soul happy... do that” thanks @kennygibsonnhs great quote 💐🌈😌 https://t.co/7ylGRorcTu
Great info graphics ... Wow, what an operation! And running against the clock with forthcoming heavy rain #ThaiCaveRescue https://t.co/2ULlLYHiQW
@Sonia_Sparkles The #NHS clearly needs you full time @Sonia_Sparkles 😊😊😊 you have such a clever way to explain concepts and your graphic communication skills are awesome 😇🎨🏆👌🏻
@Liz_ORiordan @ficklefulcrum Brilliant 😂😂😂👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻
@CatrionaRowland @HeidiHmp2811 @NewhamHospital Great moves @HeidiHmp2811 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 you’re taking “leading from the front” to a whole new level here! 😂 Looks like such an awesome evening 🕺💃🕺💃

@CatrionaRowland @AnnaDaviesMW @furniturehireuk @Barts_Charity @NewhamHospital @HeidiHmp2811 @moekam16 @CSS_BH @PocklingtonNHS @JanFlint @NHSBartsHealth @loops79blue @eatwellnewham @LVelauthar @BroFalvey @NUHmaternity Congratulations @CatrionaRowland you have really done an amazing job 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 and fab teamwork too. There are so many lovely pics 🕺💃🕺💃 of the #NHS70 party @NewhamHospital so many happy colleagues and sooooo well organised. Great work 💐
@PoppyJaman @Rahib_Tarafder @cslgbt @JPMarksDWP @CarolMorrisDWP @MMorley_JCP @fergusj1 @PrideInLondon @MHFAEngland Beautiful outfit @PoppyJaman 😍😍😍 have a lovely day at #pride

How awful... Imagine feeling like this at work 😔😳😠😥
Check in with all your colleagues and teams regularly with open ears, open ears, an open mind & an open heart
What can YOU do to tackle inequality & how can YOU further embrace diversity #WRES https://t.co/Pa4bQDAPpD
